Row.Text: A thousand welcomes to our fair nation. I am Haile Selassie, the Ras Tafari Makonnen and Emperor of Ethiopia, your humble servant.
Ethiopia welcomes those who come in peace and friendship. I look forward to a long and bountiful relationship.
Welcome, friend, to my lands of peace and prosperity. I am the Conquering Lion of the Tribe of Judah, the Lord of Lords and King of Kings, but you may call me Haile Selassie.
Such a sad waste.
It is a shame to see you behave in such a manner.
Like a small child you are, unable to grasp the bigger picture.
War is not the only means to stop war in kind - I hope you can see this now. Please, return to your lands and think upon what I have said.
Today is the day on which we defeated out enemy. However, we shall only rejoice in our hearts, and in the spirit of heaven.
Misguided people sometimes create misguided ideas, and in turn, misguided actions. It is not too late for you to find the path of truth.
Know that you are being watched by your nation: if you continue to do evil, it will lose hope and confidence in you.
God and history will remember your actions this day. I hope you are ready for your impending judgment.
It saddens me to see that the spirit of the wicked continues to cast its shadow on this world. May you find your own peace, before you lead your people to destruction.
In general, a man who is governed by his conscience will co-operate with his fellow human beings. He knows from whence he comes and where he goes. Do you?
A thousand welcomes.
Greetings.
Until we meet again.
Goodbye.
Very well.
Your offer is very interesting, but it is not quite acceptable. Please rethink this.
Can you do a little better?
That's not quite good enough.
Almost...
I am not interested.
You had but to ask. However, I would suggest in the future that you ask more politely.
I am sorry, but we are bound in our own affairs at the moment. You shall be in our thoughts, however.
I request that you consider this offer between our two peoples. I believe it will do us both good.
I come humbly seeking your generosity in our time of need. Evil is upon us, and we are not equipped to handle it by ourselves.
All right.
Very Well.
I must refuse.
No.
Go on.
Go ahead.
Welcome.
How are you, friend?
Farewell.
Goodbye.
Agreed.
My friend, I am sure you mean well, but this cannot do. We may be simple people, but we will not be taken advantage of.
Is that the best you can do?
You're almost there...
Thank you, but no.
Any aid in the fight against the wicked and the evil is freely given to those who ask.
A thousand apologies, but we cannot hope to part with this at this time. Is there anything else we may help you with?
Let us dine together and discuss matters of the world. We are not material people at heart, but we have some things that may interest you.
Friend, Ethiopia calls to you in her hour of need. Please do not leave us beaten upon the rocks of providence.
Certainly.
Certainly not.
We decline.
Proceed.
I'm listening.
Well?
What do you want?
That is all.
Go away now.
Agreed.
What cruelty and ill will do you wish to impart upon my people? I have rarely seen such maliciousness.
That's not good enough.
You must do better than that.
Almost...
This absurdity is an affront to the Lord and his peoples. Be gone, and leave me in peace.
I have not the physical means to stop you in this. That may not, however, always be the case.
What would you take from me that you have not already? You would turn the land to dust and ash.
I hope we may yet set aside our differences in the interest of discourse.
The poor, the sick, the elderly - they require aid. Would even you turn your back on them?
I suppose I must.
I beg your pardon?
That's unacceptable.
You cannot be serious!
And?
We do not elect to return evil for evil, nor indulge in the atrocities which you tend to favor. However, I will not idly sit by and let you do as you please.
We do not come to this decision lightly, but we will fight when necessary. We shall win as we are confident in the victory of good over evil.
I have tried all other avenues, but yet you persist in this madness. I hope, for your sake, your end is swift.
As St. George has killed the dragon, so will we rise up and stand against this godless and cruel dragon which has risen to oppress mankind.
It is silence that allows evil to triumph. We will not stand mute and allow you to continue on this mad quest unchecked.
You prey upon the weak around you, ever hungry, never satisfied. After us, who is next? We will stand strong and protect.

Throughout history, it has been the inaction of those who could have acted; the indifference of those who should have known better; the silence of the voice of justice when it mattered most; that has made it possible for evil to triumph.
It is much easier to show compassions to animals. They are never wicked.
